problem.p: The pendulum shown in the figure above (a ball of mass \(m \) at the end of a string of length \(L\) ) is released from rest when the string is perfectly horizontal and swings down to hit the box (mass \( M > m \) ). The pendulum string is vertical when the collision occurs. The pendulum stops after it hits the box, and the box slides a distance \(d \) along a rough horizontal surface until it stops. The drawing above shows the beginning and end of the motion of the pendulum and the box. You are asked to find the coefficient of kinetic friction between the box and the surface using the quantities described in the problem plus the gravitational acceleration \( g\). What is the most appropriate way to decompose this problem?
My answer to part 1 is justified because:

choicegroup.choice: a. Mechanical energy is conserved throughout.
c. The collision must be analyzed to find the force of the pendulum as it hits the box.
d. The collision must be analyzed to determine the energy transferred from the pendulum to the block.
e. Statements a and c are both needed to explain the decomposition.
